basics.name: Madeline Adee
basics.label: Health Policy PhD Candidate
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

research.summary: Leading analysis of Oakland Police Department stops and involuntary commitment.
Worked on projects related to improving health and medical care within state prisons.
highlights: Interviewed incarcerated women about medical care and hospice care (CA)
Evaluated progress of corrections officer culture change program (OR)

research.summary: Worked on research for the California Prison Roadmap for Targeting Efforts to Address the Ecosystem of COVID Transmission (CalPROTECT).

research.company: Institute for Technology Assessment, Massachusetts General Hospital
research.summary: Worked on cost-effectiveness and disease outcomes studies, in the topic areas of hepatitis C, liver cancer, opioid use disorder, and COVID-19.

research.company: Center for the Health of Incarcerated Persons, Rollins School of Public Health, Emory University
research.summary: Assisted with various research projects focused on infectious disease distribution, access to treatment, policy change, and linkage to care after release, among individuals who are incarcerated.
Assisted with quantitative and qualitative analysis for the Anthropology department and a systematic literature review in the School of Community Health.

teaching.course: Practicum in MCH Data Analysis II (PBHLTH 210F)
Health Policy and Management Breadth Course (PHW200E)

teaching.institution: Rollins School of Public Health, Emory University
teaching.course: Introduction to the U.S. Healthcare System (HPM 500)

teaching.institution: University Studies Program, Portland State University
teaching.course: Yearlong Interdisciplinary Race & Social Justice Course

education.area: Health Policy, Population Health and Data Science
courses: Statistics, data science, causal inference, machine learning, reproducible research, critical theory

education.institution: Rollins School of Public Health, Emory University

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
